text: I think it could probably be assumed to be `1.0`. The `w` is the scaling factor from the homogenous self-dual embedding. Afaik, the extra variable is introduced so that primal and dual infeasibility certificates can be returned. The primal dual “solution” usually returned by a solver is `x/w`, `y/w`.  Maybe just leftover from that?
